intro: Camptacra brachycomoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. The leaves are narrow, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
